item.title: Reply from Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation
item.description: KEY POINT OF THIS EVENT: By acknowledging that McDonald’s Corporation executives “take such inquiries seriously”, McDonald’s Corporation can’t claim plausible deniability anymore. Furthermore, the email from Ms. Santona who is the General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation is CCed to the CEO of McDonald’s Corporation Steve Easterbrook. Click on this link to visualize the original email: MCD–2-2015-10-21-23h47CN_Redacted.pdf From: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Subject: Re: update Date received：2015-10-21 23:47 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Vincent B. Le Corre

item.title: Email sent to Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation, requesting an update
item.description: From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: update Date sent：2015-10-21 22:45 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook Ms. Santona, I would like to give a friendly reminder that I gave McDonald’s a deadline of October 22nd 2015 midnight GMT time. So you have about 36 hours left. It was 4 entire days which is more than enough considering I’ve sent my first cease and desist letter back in 2012. On top of this, had I known that the French branch had started scamming people again, I would have at the time only given you 24 to 48 hours.

item.title: McDonald’s Corporation v. Simon Marketing 2002-09-16
item.description: Around January 2023, I found out that McDonald’s Corporation sued their supplier under RICO. It’s an important piece of evidence because it proves that when I would keep notifying, in 2015, McDonald’s Corporation, sternly warning them that they were committing fraud, they could only have immediately understood that the roles were now reversed: McDonald’s Corporation was now the criminal and they were engaging, via their subsidiary companies, in a pattern of racketeering activity. “MEMORANDUM OPINION AND ORDER
